description: Demolition of existing garage and erection of single storey front and rear extension and a two storey side extension
decision_conditions: The proposed hip to gable roof conversion and gable roof form on the two storey side extension would unbalance the pair of semi-detached dwellings at Nos. 10 and 12 Forest Side, Worcester Park KT4 7PB. The roof forms on the proposed development would add significant bulk above the eaves height of the host dwelling, and would appear incongruous with the immediate setting of the site. The proposal would therefore fail to comply with the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Policies CS8 and DM 10 of the adopted Core Strategy (2012) and Policy Guidance 36 and paragraph 4.29 of the Council's Residential Design Supplementary Planning Document (2013).

Condition 101 (Construction Management Plan) Part 1 - RBK Neighbourhood Engineer and TFL have reviewed the information submitted and are satisfied this can now be approved.The applicant must ensure that all necessary highways licenses (e.g. hoarding, scaffolding, oversailing and tower crane) and any temporary traffic management orders as may be needed are in place prior to work upon which they rely.The Highway Authority reserves the right to require amendments to the construction traffic management as may be necessary should any issues be later identified.Prior to commencing any construction work the applicant should contact the Highways Inspection Team to arrange for a highway condition survey to be undertaken.
